annotations.comments: Metadata license: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/, except abstracts which may have copyright
Not all data on the website seems to be in OAI the endpoint
They say it's included in B2FIND, but it's not (at least not recent submissions)
The date is always today, so it's removed in structuring
All data on the server under a non-commercial license: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/
Documents not included, so only 250 left after processing

name: University of Bristol Research Data Repository

annotations.comments: GeographicCoverage to be translated. Completely different format, so left for now (294 entries)

Data Portal of the Dutch Government

annotations.comments: Also included in ANDS, but descriptions are better in the source portal
Only harvesting collections, since files have another URL pattern, and they're probably included in the collections
Only items with DOI are exposed through OAI-PMH
Included in search.datacite.org. Old version. New version is included in dataone. Seems to be no overlap, so this is kept...

annotations.issues: Only 55 out of 65 harvested. Does not only affect last one

annotations.comments: Very inefficient. Need to download the whole DB for only 82 entries

name: Democratic Republic of the Congo Data Portal

annotations.comments: Very low fraction is actually Dataset or software, no sets for this...

They recommend to publish metadata under license https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Check later if oai_datacite format is better here... Also: There is software (item_type_9), but harvesting fails for that set
CKAN is still up-to-date and used, but the overall site seems to include more datasets...
Has the keys location_coordinates and location_coordinates_type, which could be used to create a GeoJSON of the location. Not worth the effort atm
Nothing about metadata license in terms of use
